verses.verse: I am gone (Ps. 102:11) like a shadow when it lengthens; I am shaken off like a locust.
My (Heb. 12:12) knees are weak through fasting, And my flesh is feeble from lack of fatness.
I also have become (Ps. 22:7; Jer. 18:16; Lam. 2:15) a reproach to them; When they look at me, (Matt. 27:39; Mark 15:29) they shake their heads.
Help me, O LORD my God! Oh, save me according to Your mercy,
(Job 37:7) That they may know that this is Your handâ€” That You, LORD, have done it!
(2 Sam. 6:11, 12) Let them curse, but You bless; When they arise, let them be ashamed, But let (Is. 65:14) Your servant rejoice.
(Job 8:22; Ps. 35:26) Let my accusers be clothed with shame, And let them cover themselves with their own disgrace as with a mantle.
